summary: SEEING STARS AT THE DETECTIVE PIKACHU PREMIERE
title: SEEING STARS AT THE DETECTIVE PIKACHU PREMIERE
body:
The eagerly anticipated movie POKÉMON Detective Pikachu recently premiered in Tokyo, Japan, where the stars of the movie paraded down the red carpet in front of thousands of people…actually, make that a yellow carpet, in the zig-zag shape of Pikachu’s tail! It was a wild scene, with celebrities, costumed Pokémon fans, and moviegoers packed in to see the cast of the highly anticipated movie.

Before they stepped out into the crowds, we were lucky enough to chat with the stars of the film. We sat down with Justice Smith and Kathryn Newton, who play the movie’s main (human) characters, Tim Goodman and Lucy Stevens, as well as the voice of Detective Pikachu himself, Ryan Reynolds. They were as eager to talk about their love of Pokémon as they were about the movie! Read on to hear about their experience making POKÉMON Detective Pikachu.

Check out interviews with the cast here

summary: How neat is it that the first live-action Pokémon movie actually cast a black actor to play it's main human character (Where the...
question: How neat is it that the first live-action Pokémon movie actually cast a black actor to play it's main human character (Where the character was white in the game it was based on)? Like, if they really are going to make a whole cinematic universe out of this series, they're already starting off doing better at diversity than a lot of these other pop culture film franchises.
answer:
I know right?

Like even though Pokemon wasn’t diverse, to begin with, they’ve been slowly adding more characters of color and for this movie, the first live-action Pokemon movie to feature a black main character? That’s big.

reblog.comment:
I know right?

Like even though Pokemon wasn’t diverse, to begin with, they’ve been slowly adding more characters of color and for this movie, the first live-action Pokemon movie to feature a black main character? That’s big.

summary: Since Detective Pikachu looks like it's going to be a big hit, what other kinds of things do you want to see adapted into...
question: Since Detective Pikachu looks like it's going to be a big hit, what other kinds of things do you want to see adapted into Pokémon movies in the future?
answer:
Honestly, as long as the story is good and the characters are good, I don’t really care.

However, I Don’t really want Ash in the movies. I mean I used to like him as a kid but I feel like Ash is kinda lame. Or you know what? I’d love to see a grown up Ash.

reblog.comment:

However, I Don’t really want Ash in the movies. I mean I used to like him as a kid but I feel like Ash is kinda lame. Or you know what? I’d love to see a grown up Ash.
trail.content:
Honestly, as long as the story is good and the characters are good, I don’t really care.

However, I Don’t really want Ash in the movies. I mean I used to like him as a kid but I feel like Ash is kinda lame. Or you know what? I’d love to see a grown up Ash.

summary: Bought my ticket for Detective Pikachu for May 10th at 10:30am. Why so early? Kids are in school, it’s quieter, and I really...
body: Bought my ticket for Detective Pikachu for May 10th at 10:30am. Why so early? Kids are in school, it’s quieter, and I really want those Pokémon promo cards. I got 3 of 4 cards from the first Pokémon movie, I’ll like to have this one before the kids comes out from school and they ran out.
